page.title: 14WICKSTEED PARK-LOCAL VIEWS
page.content: We interviewed 181 people from 18 streets near Wicksteed Park to find their views on the great park of Kettering. 11 visited every day, 16 never went, mostly because they were too old and 154 visited quite often.30 times a year was the average visit.People took dogs for walks, went for picnics, to enjoy the peace and quiet in some parts of the park and to take children and grandchildren on the amusements. Charles Wicksteed meant the Park to be free for the Kettering townsfolk. We asked people what they thought about paying for amusements. The elderly were Â£annoyed, disgusted and angry' and thought it was a Â£con'. "I preferred it the old way when we didn't have to pay at all," said an old man. Younger people thought charges were reasonable. Parking is free.
